*******************************
API Reference Manual for Python
*******************************

.. toctree::
   :maxdepth: 4
   
   .

This manual contains a summary of the ``pyalps`` functions used in the ALPS tutorials. The Python API section is structure as follow:
 * :ref:`ref-pyalps-running`: Functions to run ALPS applications
 * :ref:`ref-pyalps-loading`: Functions to load measurements generated by specific applications
 * :ref:`ref-pyalps-evaluation`: Generic functions to perform data analysis, e.g. collect results and plotting.

Please refer to the `ALPS application tutorials <https://alps.comp-phys.org/mediawiki/index.php/ALPS_2_Tutorials:Overview>`_ to see how these functions
are employed in real simulations. For example: how to scan several temperatures and plot average magnetization as a function of temperature, or how to
extrapolate finite-size effects.
